should not be used for evaluation for osteoporosis.

Recommendations:
National Osteoporosis Foundation (NOF) guidelines recommend
initiating therapy to reduce fracture risk in women with BMD:

T-Score below -2 SD
T-Score below -1.5 SD with other risk factors present

Mild to aggressive therapies are available in the form of Hormone
replacement therapy (HRT), Bisphosphonates, Calcitonin, and
SERMs.  Additionally, all patients should ensure an adequate
intake of dietary calcium (1200mg/d) and vitamin D (400-800 IU
daily).

People with diagnosed cases of osteoporosis should be regularly
tested for bone mineral density.  For patients eligible for
Medicare, routine testing is allowed once every 2 years.  Testing
frequency can be increased for patients who have rapidly
progressing disease, or for those who are receiving medical
therapy to restore bone mass.
